content:
The word outlook in relation to Microsoft is way overloaded.

I am assuming you have added and outlook.com email address to Thunderbird and you previously used the application outlook in which you created folders. Did you import that into Thunderbird from the installed outlook, in which case your folders in the outlook application will import.

If you added the outlook.com account to Thunderbird, then only folders that appear on the outlook.com web site can be included, and then you have to subscribe to some by right clicking on the account name in the folder pane and selecting subscribe from the menu.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Hi Matt, Thanks for helping. Actually, there's another level of information that I completed overlooked. I added an account for an email address on an external email server to the Outlook app on my laptop. Then in Outlook I created folders for that email. It isn't an Outlook email address as such. But as Outlook has limited forwarding and filtering without paying a subscription, I decided to try Thunderbird. (I hope this is making sense and that I've got the terminology correct.) I downloaded and installed Thunderbird and created an account for the same email address on the external email server. I now realise that as Thunderbird is reading the email from the server not from Outlook, of course the folders haven't copied over. I tried your suggestion using subscribe but this naturally only picks up the folders on the server, which are the standard built-in folders. Given the situation, I suspect that there's no way to get the folders from Outlook. Or is there?
creator: ayyaesika

content: Go to Settings > General > Start Page, delete the "https://live.thunderbird.net/%APP%/start?locale=....." address and on next TB starts you'll see an empty start page. If you don't like a white start page you can customise it by adding the path to some landscape picture or some person's photo in the "Location" bar

content:
If you prior history is correct and you are using an IMAP account with google you should have do not make a copy clicked as google make their own copy when you send an email and place it in sent.

You can not turn off Googles copy, so it is logical to turn off Thunderbird as you do not need two copies.

content:
Hai aggiunto alla rubrica l'indirizzo sbagliato:

La PEC nel sistema italiano è una particolare email con valore legale. Per ottenere questo risultato la comunicazione tra un mittente MITT ed un destinatario DEST è mediata dal una società abilitata alla gestione della PEC rispondente a precisi requisiti tecnici [1] (GEST). Nelle intestazioni della PEC avremi quindi riferimenti a MITT, DEST e GEST.

Supponiamo che DEST, ricevuta una PEC da MITT, voglia aggiungere il mittente alla propria rubrica di Thunderbird. A volte capita che al nome di MITT non vanga associato il relativo indirizzo email ma quello dell'intermediario GEST. Il risultato è che da quel momento in poi tutte le PEC ricevute da utenti di GEST appariranno con mittente MIT, talvolta con la dicitura "per conto di".

Per risolvere il problema è necessario cancellare il contatto MITT dalla rubrica.
creator: @next

content:
For the csv, I suggest this: - highlight and delete all content on the addressbook - place one valid email address in thunderbird addressbook - export the csv and upload to a spreadsheet - compare the csv from thunderbird to that from Outlook and adjust the outlook csv to mirror the thunderbird csv, including first row - save as csv and it should import properly.

- I suggest removing the gmail account and start over - close and then restart thunderbird - in addressbook pane, select the 'new addressbook' icon - then, select the carddav option and insert your gmail address and complete the installation
creator: davidsk

content:
This is always what will appear if someone updates to version 128, but it will not appear again if you stay on version 128.

Your description does not have quite enough information to understand why you are seeing this. Are you attempting to stay on version 115, you are updated to 128, you see that web page, and then reinstall 115? If so, which specific version of 115?

If that isn't accurate then please explain exactly your process.

Thanks.
